title: MCP Server Tools Ecosystem - Complete Reference
body:
# MCP Server Tools Ecosystem - Complete Reference

## Overview
Comprehensive documentation of all Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers configured in the development environment, their tools, capabilities, and integration patterns.

## HTTP-Based MCP Servers

### Microsoft Docs AI Gateway
- **URL**: `https://mcp-build2025.azure-api.net/learn`
- **Type**: HTTP MCP Server
- **Purpose**: Access to Microsoft Learn content and documentation
- **Key Capabilities**:
  - Documentation search across Microsoft Learn
  - AI-powered content retrieval
  - Learning path recommendations
  - Technical article analysis
- **Use Cases**: Documentation research, learning guidance, technical reference

### GitHub MCP Server
- **URL**: `https://api.githubcopilot.com/mcp`
- **Type**: HTTP MCP Server
- **Purpose**: GitHub integration through Copilot infrastructure
- **Key Capabilities**:
  - Repository search and analysis
  - Code snippet retrieval
  - Issue and PR management
  - GitHub Actions integration
- **Use Cases**: Code research, repository analysis, GitHub workflow automation

### Microsoft Learn MCP Server
- **URL**: `https://learn.microsoft.com/api/mcp`
- **Type**: HTTP MCP Server
- **Purpose**: Direct access to Microsoft Learn API
- **Key Capabilities**:
  - Learning module access
  - Certification path information
  - Technical documentation retrieval
  - Learning progress tracking
- **Use Cases**: Learning and development, certification preparation, skill assessment

## STDIO-Based MCP Servers

### Azure MCP Server
- **Command**: `npx -y @azure/mcp@latest server start`
- **Type**: STDIO MCP Server
- **Purpose**: Comprehensive Azure service integration
- **Key Tool Categories**:
  - **Azure CLI Tools**: 30+ command categories
  - **Azure Developer CLI (azd)**: Project scaffolding and deployment
  - **Azure Quick Review CLI (azqr)**: Compliance and security scanning
  - **Service-Specific Tools**: Container Registry, Kubernetes, App Configuration
- **Authentication**: Azure CLI credential, managed identity, access keys
- **Capabilities**:
  - Resource management across all Azure services
  - Subscription and resource group operations
  - Deployment and monitoring
  - Security and compliance analysis
- **Use Cases**: Azure infrastructure management, DevOps automation, compliance monitoring

### Azure DevOps MCP Server
- **Command**: `npx -y @azure-devops/mcp@latest ${input:ado_org}`
- **Type**: STDIO MCP Server
- **Purpose**: Azure DevOps integration and workflow automation
- **Key Tool Categories**:
  - **Project Management**: Project creation, updates, team management
  - **Repository Operations**: Git operations, branch management, PR workflows
  - **CI/CD Pipelines**: Build and release pipeline management
  - **Work Item Management**: Agile planning, sprint management, backlog prioritization
  - **Testing Tools**: Test plans, execution, coverage reporting
  - **Package Management**: Azure Artifacts integration
  - **Security & Compliance**: Permission management, audit logging
  - **Analytics**: Velocity metrics, deployment frequency, failure analysis
- **Authentication**: Personal Access Token (PAT), Azure AD
- **Use Cases**: DevOps workflow automation, project management, CI/CD optimization

### Dev Box MCP Server
- **Command**: `npx -y @microsoft/devbox-mcp@latest`
- **Type**: STDIO MCP Server
- **Purpose**: Microsoft Dev Box cloud development environment integration
- **Key Capabilities**:
  - Dev Box provisioning and management
  - Environment configuration
  - Resource allocation and scaling
  - Development workspace orchestration
- **Use Cases**: Cloud development environment setup, team standardization

### PowerShell MCP Server
- **Command**: `node dist/server.js`
- **Working Directory**: `c:\mcp\powershell-mcp-server`
- **Type**: STDIO MCP Server (Custom Build)
- **Purpose**: PowerShell command execution and Windows system integration
- **Key Capabilities**:
  - PowerShell command execution
  - Windows system administration
  - Registry operations
  - File system management
  - Process and service control
- **Use Cases**: Windows automation, system administration, legacy integration

### Obfuscate MCP Server
- **Command**: `node C:\github\jagilber\obfuscate-mcp-server\build\index.js`
- **Type**: STDIO MCP Server (Custom Development)
- **Purpose**: Code obfuscation and security tooling
- **Configuration**:
  - Metrics dashboard enabled (127.0.0.1)
  - SSE updates every 1500ms
  - Max 15 concurrent clients
  - Default admin password: `vscode-mcp`
  - Instructions directory: `C:/github/jagilber/obfuscate-mcp-server/.github`
- **Key Capabilities**:
  - Code obfuscation and transformation
  - Security analysis and hardening
  - Metrics and monitoring dashboard
  - Real-time performance monitoring
- **Use Cases**: Code protection, security hardening, development metrics

### MCP Index Server
- **Command**: `node dist/server/index.js`
- **Working Directory**: `C:/mcp/mcp-index-server-prod`
- **Type**: STDIO MCP Server (Production)
- **Purpose**: Centralized instruction and knowledge management
- **Environment Configuration**:
  - Instructions Directory: `C:/mcp/mcp-index-server-prod/instructions`
  - Mutation Enabled: Yes
  - Feedback Directory: `./feedback`
- **Key Tool Categories**:
  - **Core System**: Health, diagnostics, metadata (7 tools)
  - **Instruction Management**: CRUD operations, catalog management (15 tools)
  - **Enterprise Governance**: Compliance, gating, reviews (3 tools)
  - **Usage Analytics**: Tracking, hotsets, metrics (3 tools)
  - **Feedback System**: Collection, management, analysis (6 tools)
  - **AI/Prompt Tools**: Analysis and review (1 tool)
- **Total Tools**: 43 builtin tools
- **Use Cases**: Knowledge management, instruction governance, team collaboration

## Integration Patterns

### Authentication Strategies

#### Azure Services
- **Azure CLI**: Default credential chain
- **Azure MCP**: Managed identity, service principal, PAT
- **Azure DevOps**: Personal Access Token, Azure AD

#### Development Tools
- **GitHub**: OAuth integration through Copilot
- **PowerShell**: Windows integrated authentication
- **Custom Servers**: API keys, local authentication

### Configuration Management

#### Environment Variables
- `INSTRUCTIONS_DIR`: Instruction storage location
- `MCP_ENABLE_MUTATION`: Enable write operations
- `FEEDBACK_DIR`: Feedback storage location
- `AZURE_SUBSCRIPTION_ID`: Default Azure subscription

#### Input Parameters
- `ado_org`: Azure DevOps organization name
- Dynamic configuration for server-specific needs

## Tool Categories Summary

### By Server Type
- **HTTP Servers**: 3 (Documentation and external integrations)
- **STDIO Servers**: 6 (Local and cloud service integrations)
- **Total Servers**: 9 comprehensive MCP integrations

### By Functional Area
- **Cloud Infrastructure**: Azure MCP Server (30+ services)
- **DevOps Workflows**: Azure DevOps MCP Server (8 categories)
- **Documentation**: Microsoft Learn, Docs AI Gateway (3 servers)
- **Development Environment**: Dev Box, PowerShell MCP (2 servers)
- **Knowledge Management**: MCP Index Server (43 tools)
- **Security & Code Quality**: Obfuscate MCP Server (custom)
- **Version Control**: GitHub MCP Server (repository operations)

## Best Practices

### Server Selection
- Use **Azure MCP Server** for infrastructure operations
- Use **Azure DevOps MCP Server** for CI/CD and project management
- Use **MCP Index Server** for knowledge and instruction management
- Use **GitHub MCP Server** for code research and repository analysis
- Use **Microsoft Learn servers** for documentation and learning

### Performance Optimization
- Configure appropriate timeout values for long-running operations
- Use caching for frequently accessed data
- Implement proper error handling and retry logic
- Monitor server performance through metrics dashboards

### Security Considerations
- Rotate authentication credentials regularly
- Use least-privilege access principles
- Enable audit logging for sensitive operations
- Secure API keys and access tokens
- Implement proper network security for HTTP servers

## Troubleshooting Guide

### Common Issues
1. **Authentication Failures**
   - Verify credentials and permissions
   - Check token expiration dates
   - Validate network connectivity

2. **Server Startup Issues**
   - Check working directory paths
   - Verify Node.js and npm versions
   - Validate environment variables

3. **Tool Execution Problems**
   - Review server logs for errors
   - Check input parameter formats
   - Verify required dependencies

### Diagnostic Commands
- Health checks for all configured servers
- Connection testing for HTTP endpoints
- Log analysis for STDIO servers
- Performance metrics monitoring

## Development Workflow Integration

### Daily Development
1. **MCP Index Server**: Access shared knowledge and instructions
2. **Azure MCP Server**: Manage cloud resources and deployments
3. **GitHub MCP Server**: Research code patterns and repositories
4. **PowerShell MCP Server**: Windows system operations

### DevOps Operations
1. **Azure DevOps MCP Server**: Pipeline management and work tracking
2. **Azure MCP Server**: Infrastructure provisioning and monitoring
3. **Obfuscate MCP Server**: Code security and quality analysis

### Learning and Research
1. **Microsoft Learn servers**: Documentation and learning paths
2. **GitHub MCP Server**: Open source research
3. **MCP Index Server**: Institutional knowledge access

## Maintenance and Updates

- **Update Frequency**: Monthly for npm packages (`@latest` ensures current versions)
- **Configuration Review**: Quarterly review of server configurations
- **Security Audits**: Regular credential rotation and access review
- **Performance Monitoring**: Continuous monitoring through metrics dashboards
- **Backup Strategy**: Regular backup of instruction data and configurations

This comprehensive MCP server ecosystem provides complete coverage for enterprise development, DevOps, cloud operations, and knowledge management workflows.
